Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Father Marek Suchocki, St. Stanislaus Kostki Church, 109 York Avenue, Staten Island, NY  10301.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member McMahon.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Father Marek Suchocki, St. Stanislaus Kostki Church, 109 York Avenue, Staten Island, N.Y. 10301.

Council Member McMahon moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of June 26, 2002 be adopted and printed by Council Member Clarke.
Items.MinutesNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of June 30, 2002 be adopted as printed by Council Member McMahon.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 6, to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the suspension of alternate side of the street parking rules on the Asian Lunar New Year.
Items.MatterName: Veto of Int. No. 6,  Asian Lunar New Year

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 37, to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the suspension of alternate side of the street parking rules on the religious holidays of Purim and Ash Wednesday.
Items.MatterName: Veto of Int. No. 37, Parking, Alternate Side Suspension Purim etc.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 156-A, to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to the procurement of energy efficient products.
Items.MatterName: Veto of Int. No. 156-A, Procurement of energy efficient products.

Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. 20010340 MMM shall be subject to review by the Council.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment by the Mayor of NICHOLAS ANDREW LAPORTE as a member of the New York City Civil Service Commission.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which was referred to on September 25, 2002, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to sections 31 and 813 of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the appointment by the Mayor of NICHOLAS ANDREW LAPORTE as a member of the New York City Civil Service Commission to serve for the remainder of a six-year term that commenced on March 22, 2001 and will expire on March 21, 2007.

Res. No. 568

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE MAYOR OF NICHOLAS ANDREW LAPORTE AS A MEMBER OF THE  NEW YORK CITY CIVIL SERVICE COMMISSION.

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to sections 31 and 813 of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Mayor of NICHOLAS ANDREW LAPORTE as a member of the New York City Civil Service Commission for the remainder of a six-year term that commenced on March 22, 2001 and will expire on March 21, 2007.
Items.MatterName: M 312 - Nicholas LaPorte, Jr., Civil Service Commission

Items.Title:
Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the appointment by the Brooklyn Borough President of  DOLLY WILLIAMS as a Member of the New York City Planning Commission.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections which was referred to on September 25, 2002, respectfully

REPORTS

Pursuant to sections 31 and 192(a) of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the appointment by the Brooklyn Borough President of DOLLY WILLIAMS as a Member of the New York City Planning Commission to serve for the remainder a five-year term expiring on June 30, 2007.

Res. No. 569

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE APPOINTMENT BY THE BROOKLYN BOROUGH PRESIDENT OF DOLLY WILLIAMS AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY PLANNING COMMISSION.

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to sections 31 and 192(a) of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the appointment by the Brooklyn Borough President of DOLLY WILLIAMS as a Member of the New York City Planning Commission to serve for the remainder of a five-year term expiring on June 30, 2007.
Items.MatterName: M 313 - Dolly Williams, City Planning Commission

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to requiring the placement of a stop sign or traffic control signal at each end of every pedestrian overpass in New York City.
Items.MatterName: Place a stop sign/traffic control signal at each end of every pedestrian overpass in NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of specific criteria for the evaluation and placement of traffic control devices within the City of New York.
Items.MatterName: Establishment of specific criteria for the evaluation and placement of traffic control devices within NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the legislature of the State of New York to amend Article 22 of Title VI of the New York State Vehicle and Traffic Law to require all insurance companies to provide the New York City Department of Transportation with statistics and other information relating to all motor vehicle accidents occurring on streets and highways within the City of New York.
Items.MatterName: Insurance companies to provide DOT with statistics and other info relating to all motor vehicle accidents,

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the issuance of certificates of occupancy for one-, two- or three-family dwellings.
Items.MatterName: Issuance of certificates of occupancy for one-, two- or three-family dwellings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Senate to adopt S.4749-A, in relation to increasing the state minimum wage from $5.15 to $6.75 per hour and indexing future increases based on the state average weekly wage.
Items.MatterName: Increasing the state minimum wage from $5.15 to $6.75 per hour

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to modifying matchable contributions for participating candidates in the campaign finance program and eliminating references to political contributions from corporations.
Items.MatterName: Modifying matchable contributions for participating candidates in the campaign finance program.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a street name, Rabbi Yaakov Spiegel Way, Borough of Manhattan.
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Rabbi Yaakov Spiegel Way, Manhattan

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to ownership of service pipes in the area that was supplied with water by the Jamaica Water Supply Company.
Items.MatterName: Ownership of service pipes in the area that was supplied with water by the Jamaica Water Supply Company.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to sidewalk cafes, and to repeal subdivisions (c), (d) and (l) of section 20-226 of such code.
Items.MatterName: In relation to sidewalk cafes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to liability for certain injuries or damage.
Items.MatterName: Liability for certain injuries or damage.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Legislature to amend subdivision a of section 777 of Article 7-A of the Real Property Actions and Proceedings Law of New York State by permitting only sixty days for consent orders and forbidding landlords from using consent orders more than once.
Items.MatterName: Amend subdivision a of section 777 of Article 7-A of the Real Property Actions and Proceedings Law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to make available a nurse to all public and private primary and intermediate schools on a full-time basis.
Items.MatterName: Make available a nurse to all public /private primary and intermediate schools on a full-time basis

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass A.02851 and S.03279, which amend the New York State Penal Law to include the crime of financial exploitation of the elderly.
Items.MatterName: Amend the NYS Penal Law to include the crime of financial exploitation of the elderly.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass a bill to restore the right to vote for parolees, and also calling upon the United States Congress to pass H.R.259, also known as the Civic Participation and Rehabilitation Act of 2003, to secure the federal voting rights of persons who have been released from incarceration.
Items.MatterName: Restore the right to vote to parolees.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate Committee of the Council to conduct an oversight hearing on the NYPD's request to alter the Handschu agreement.
Items.MatterName: Conduct an oversight hearing on the NYPD's request to alter the Handschu agreement.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the government of the United States to make all efforts to work through the United Nations Security Council in a manner that would reaffirm our nation's commitment to the rule of law and the primacy of human rights in our international relationships, and to take all appropriate steps toward securing the participation of other nations and international bodies in the effort to ensure that Iraq does not possess biological, chemical or nuclear weapons and toward promoting human rights for all the people of Iraq; and further calling on the government of the United States to work through the United Nations Security Council and with other nations to ensure the unimpeded access of United Nations weapons inspectors to all areas of and facilities in Iraq and to ensure that the inspectors be given a full and fair opportunity to conduct their efforts in accordance with United Nations Security Council resolutions; and further calling upon the Council of the City of New York to oppose a pre-emptive military attack on Iraq unless it is demonstrated that Iraq poses a real and imminent threat to the security and safety of the United States or its allies or unless other options for achieving compliance with United Nations resolutions calling for the elimination of weapons of mass destruction and the means for their development have failed.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Oppose the Congressional Resolution allowing President George W. Bush to unilaterally declare war against Iraq.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a street name, Throggs Neck Expressway, Borough of The Bronx.
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Throggs Neck Expressway, Borough of The Bronx.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to enact A.5384, an act to amend the general business law, in relation to the licensing of sellers of aerosol spray paint cans and broad tipped indelible markers.
Items.MatterName: Licensing of sellers of aerosol spray paint cans and broad tipped indelible markers.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Congress of the United States to distribute homeland security funding directly to the City of New York and other localities across the nation based upon risk assessment and target potential, to ensure maximum receipt of federal funds.
Items.MatterName: Fiscal 2003 Federal Budget appropriation of $3.5 billion

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to banning the sale of toy guns.
Items.MatterName: Banning the sale of toy guns.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the Clean Money, Clean Elections Act (A.3453A / S.3440A), a bill that would drastically improve the campaign finance system in New York State by lowering contribution limits, improving reporting requirements and enforcement, and most importantly, instituting a voluntary system of public financing of elections.
Items.MatterName: Clean Money, Clean Elections Act (A.2630-A, S.1638-A)

Items.Title: Zoning resolution amendment application no. N 030119 ZRY, pursuant to Sections 197-d and 200 of the New York City Charter, respecting changes in the text of the Zoning Resolution, Article I, Chapter 4, relating to sidewalk café regulations.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Sidewalk café, City Wide (N030119ZRY)

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 010340 MMM, pursuant to Sections 197-c and 197-d of the New York City Charter, changes to the City Map, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 3. This matter is subject to Council Review and action only if apealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)2 of the Charter or called up by a vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)3 of the Charter and Section 11.20 of the Rules of the Council.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 78 Varick St, Manhattan (C010340MMM)

Items.Title: Roll Call
Resolutions
General Discussion

Resolution calling upon Congress and the President to enact H.R. 5523 and S.3055, to amend the Community Disaster Loan provisions of the Stafford Act to eliminate the $5 million cap on these loans so that they may be used to make up lost revenues and unreimbursed expenses directly attributable to the September 11th terrorist attacks, to make these loans available to both localities and states, and to provide for forgiveness of Community Disaster Loans if the disaster was the result of a terrorist attack.
Items.MatterName: Amend Community Disaster Loan provisions of the Stafford Act to eliminate the $5 million cap.

Items.Title: Roll Call

Resolution calling upon the City of New York to invoke the spirit of the historic "Liberty Trees" by planting "Freedom Trees" in neighborhoods throughout the City to honor the memories of the men and women who died in the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks on the World Trade Center.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by the Council by unanimous voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: Planting of "Freedom Trees" for those who died in WTC 9/11

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt meaningful reform of the Rockefeller drug laws, which should include, among its elements, judicial sentencing discretion, a decrease in the amount of prison time for certain types of drug offenses, an increase in the amount of narcotics required to secure certain convictions, adequate funding of alternative to incarceration programs, and stiffer penalties for drug trafficking.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MinutesNote: Adopted by the Council by voice-vote; 4 Council Members objected to the passage of the item: Council Members Gallagher, Golden, Lanza and Oddo.
Items.MatterName: Reforming Rockefeller drug laws.

Items.MinutesNote: The presence of a quorum was announced by the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum)

Items.Title: Commissioner of Deeds
Items.MatterName: Commissioner of Deeds

Items.Title: Zoning resolution amendment application no. N 030119 ZRY, pursuant to Sections 197-d and 200 of the New York City Charter, respecting changes in the text of the Zoning Resolution, Article I, Chapter 4, relating to sidewalk café regulations.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Sidewalk café, City Wide (N030119ZRY)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to sidewalk cafes, and to repeal subdivisions (c), (d) and (l) of section 20-226 of such code.
Items.MatterName: In relation to sidewalk cafes.

Items.MinutesNote:
Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Miller), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Thursday, November 7, 2002.

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
